reviewText: Great Fun.This is about two cops who have a reputation of not doing what they are supposed and getting their man.But they are getting older and getting a little bit more concerned about their lives and getting closer to retirement. So they decide to buy a bar in Florida and turn in their retirement papers. They are asked to train their replacements and one of the biggest drug dealers gets out on bail. Those two events start a series of events that put everything into perspective. They like being cops, they like catching the bad guy and at least one of them misses his ex-wife.Watching this reminds me of Beverly Hills Cop and I believe that this is probably what set the tone for those similar movies that came after this one.One of the things that stands out watching this movie is that it is dated. By that I mean you will see clothing that looks like it's in the 80's. The car phones are early clunky car phones that only the drug dealers have, and instead of CD's they play cassette tapes in their cars. If that bothers you, this might be a movie you miss. Overall though, I didn't find the dated clothes, phones etc to be distracting.And because it is an older movie, it does not rely on special effects to make the scene. This means though that some of the scenes move slower than you might anticipate and there is not as much in the way of special effects. This means that there is less blood and gore than you might expect if this movie was remade now. I thought that was a good thing.Overall, this reflects what you might expect from a Billy Crystal movie. It's enjoyable, light and funny and yet it still has some serious tones that help you realize what really is important in life (friends, family etc).Well worth renting at a minimum. Enjoy.
summary: A typical Billy Crystal Movie and It is an enjoyable one.

reviewText: This was a great cop buddy movie.  Billy Crystal is hilarious.  I think this is one of his best roles along with City Slickers.  Gregory Hines is a good partner/sidekick.  Together, the two battle Jimmy Smits in one of his earlier roles as he tries to become the next Spanish Godfather of Chicago.  The soundtrack has some good songs from the 80s on it.  One of the best scenes from the movie is a car chase in which Billy Crystal and Gregory Hines drive a taxi car on top of the elevated subway/train track in Chicago.  Overall, I would definitely recommend this movie.  The action and comedy are great.

reviewText: Love, love, love this one from way back.  Gregory Hines has since passed and was an amazing actor, dancer and singer and it makes me a little sad to see his face once again at our loss but the combination of him and Billy Crystal - they must have had a very good time filming together. An excellent movie to watch even if it's just to see the car chase up on the el in Chicago - Priceless!  Oh, and a young Jimmy Smits ain't bad either ... hubba hubba! :)

reviewText: The laughs just keep coming as this team of unorthodox Chicago Cops become embroiled with some of the more sinister drug slingers in Pilsen the Hispanic neighborhood.  It's one of their better movies with non stop action, on foot, car chase sequences with crashes; even using the El in a long chase that is thrilling and better than those filmed in "Bullit" with Steve McQueen!

reviewText: A great story of two buddy cops (Crystal & Hines) who trail a Chicago Drug Lord. This Dramady is hilarious and well acted. A well written scrpt makes this "Buddy Movie" a great film. The witty banter between Crystal and Hines and other characters in the movie will keep you laughing. Some hilarious schtick and timely music ad to the action/excitment of two burnt out cops who need some time off!

reviewText: The only fault to RUNNING SCARED is that they never made the intended sequel, STILL RUNNING.  However, as a side note, do NOT pick up the DVD for the purported 'outtakes' advertised on the packaging; it's little more than a real of Billy Crystal talking to a camera and mucking around in his studio trailer ... a tremendous disappointment to an outstanding buddy picture.

reviewText: Hey - it's 80's cheese but no reason not to enjoy a look especially for free (Prime). I used to own this movie on laserdisc back in the day but never felt the need to reacquire it and there is no need now since there is a streaming version. It's a little soft by today's standards and the cinematography is mediocre - what were they thinking spraying foam all over Chicago as a substitute for snow? Did they think they were fooling anyone?That aside, you have to like Billy Crystal and Gregory Hines to enjoy this since they are the main driving force here. The story itself is implausible and forced but I still like to revisit it every 5-10 years.

reviewText: There are quilty pleasures{Road House} and those movies that are so bad that they become good{Show Girls}  HOWEVER this not one of those.  It is one of those jewels that doesn't show up much on tv and got lost in theaters.  The teaming of Hines and Crystal is a once in life time thing and sorry to say it turned out to be just that.  The  comedy flows and is not forced.  The leads make you like  them and you belive that they are real cops.  The chase on the El tracks is great and the building shoot out at the end is well done. Hines has a nice turn when he "arrests" another man's lover for his own.  The montage at Key West is nice.  But the sound track is 70's gold and realy moves the movie forward.  This movie holds up well.  It's really was a shame that the sequel  was never made.  Maybe that was a good thing because the sequel could never live up to the original. Look for this movie and enjoy!

reviewText: This movie was released a year earlier than the first Lethal Weapon. Too bad no interest of making a sequel as Running Scared is fun buddy-cop movie and the pairing of Billy Crystal and Gregory Hines is fun. The lovely Darlene Fluegel is the love interest. The plot is standard cop movie nothing new or original just sit back and enjoy this fun movie. The DVD is OK nowhere near a demonstration quality but certainly better than my WS LD. I would have given it five stars if only there is a 5.1 Dolby Digital and English subtitling option. But for the price, it is highly recommended DVD for both action and comedy fans as this is every bit as good as any of the Lethal Weapon series.

reviewText: Billy Crystal and Gregory Hines have a chemistry that is part pinpoint comedy timing and part facial expressions. Their comedy is never forced, contrived or racial. It’s delivered naturally like two partners with a history together. This movie draws you into a relationship that works on several levels. Running Scared could have been a successful franchise like Lethal Weapon if they could have sustained the characters and the side relationships between Crystal, Hines and their ladies. I would have loved to see these guys grow old together like Ozzie Davis and Walter Matthau in “I’m Not Rappaport.” Unfortunately, we’ll never be able to see a sequel, which makes the original all the more compelling.
summary: One of the Best Buddy Films

reviewText: I think  like this movie because it never takes itself too seriously. A lot of humor and comedy. One of the fathers of buddy movies. Gregory Hines and Billy Crystal are a team lime no other. Fast paced chatter and silly scenes leave Jimmy Smits a bity out of place as he comes off melodramatic at times. But as the heavy in the movie, I guess he would have to. If you want to see the evolution of a great comedic talent like Billy Crystal, watch this movie... and the TV show SOAP.

reviewText: If not for the crisp camaraderie between Gregory Hines and Billy Crystal as two hardboiled big city cops, this movie had very little going for it.No catchy oneliners that one'd expect from Billy, just some occasionally amusing banter. No bravura performance ala Lethal Weapon or Tango & Cash, but instead doozy villians who operate like imbeciles and are generally clueless how to give the cops a run for their money.But perhaps that was the point, the emphasis was meant to be on paperweight comedy rather than sensible action. If that's it, then it makes for a decent Friday night rental. It also has some neat visuals of Chicago.
summary: GOOD CHEMISTRY AND TIMING, BUT THE MOVIE IS HIT & MISS..
Title: N/A

reviewText: Hines and Crystal are excellent as undercover Chicago police officers who are in pursuit of dangerous drug lord Jimmy Smits, hoping to nab him before they retire to Key West. Chemistry between Hines and Crystal is perfect, and the excellent writing and direction provide for a very entertaining buddy action/comedy, one of the best ever made, even 20 years later.

reviewText: It's hilarious, the car chase on the El will have you on the edge of your seat, bullets fly in every direction, the wisecracks never stop coming, Jimmy Smits is a scene-stealer as Julio Gonzales, the would-be "Spanish Godfather," but the best thing about this movie is the chemistry between the late, great, Gregory Hines and the wonderful Billy Crystal.  You will swear that these two must have been the best of friends offscreen, their onscreen friendship is that natural and believable, and it makes the movie.  I'm not sure why it's never really been granted the place of honor that it deserves in the pantheon of '80s buddy movies; maybe folks thought it needed more darkness, or a higher body count, but it was never meant to be "Lethal Weapon," "48 Hrs," or "Die Hard;" it's an action comedy, emphasis on comedy, and a really good one.  Enjoy!
summary: Possibly the most underrated buddy action flick of all time

reviewText: Billy Crystal and Gregory Hines should've made a whole series of movies about these characters, Chicago cops who are after a crime lord and plan to get him, one way or another. Along the way they must contend with a cautious boss, moronic petty criminals, ex-wives and overly-enthusiastic younger cops just waiting to show them up. Their zeal - and an inheritance - earns them some time off, so they head to the Keys. Will they retire on the island to run a bar, or are they heading back to Chicago to do what they do best? Crystal and Hines have incredible chemistry. The dialogue contains some great humor, and the soundtrack rocks. One of my favorite films!
Title: N/A
